meanings.sent1: The team's repeated ineffectualities in scoring goals cost them the match.
meanings.sent2: The manager was frustrated by the ineffectualities of the new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the ineffectualities of a superhero with no powers.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to fix the leaky faucet only highlighted the ineffectualities of her plumbing skills.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's demonstration of the science experiment showcased the concept of ineffectualities in action.

meanings.definition: Inability to produce a desired effect
meanings.sent1: The medicine's ineffectualities in reducing pain left the patient disappointed.
meanings.sent2: Despite his efforts, the student faced the ineffectualities of his study habits during exams.
meanings.sent3: The magician's ineffectualities in pulling a rabbit out of the hat added a comedic twist to the show.
meanings.sent4: The broken compass led to the hiker's ineffectualities in finding the right path.
meanings.sent5: The detective's ineffectualities in solving the case puzzled everyone in the town.

meanings.sent1: The clutter in the garage highlighted the ineffectualities of not organizing regularly.
meanings.sent2: The old computer's ineffectualities in running modern software made it obsolete.
meanings.sent3: The rusty key's ineffectualities in opening the lock added a touch of frustration to the situation.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out broom's ineffectualities in sweeping the floor led to a messy room.
meanings.sent5: The employee's ineffectualities in completing tasks on time affected the whole team's productivity.
